originalText: Are you from the new group?
Hello. I've got to inspect some equipment, so how about catching me a bit later, okay? Thank you.

::You find him packing equipment in a box. He puts it aside for a moment and addresses you with a downhearted tone of voice.::

$(context.player.Name). Anything you need before I pack it all up?
::You find him packing his equipment.:: $(context.player.Name). Anything you need before the laborers start taking things out?
Anything you need before the laborers start taking things out?
I just remembered: Chief Briggs needs to see you. Urgently.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: We're under attack! Get to your position!
That's it. I'll meet you back at the tent.
Phew! We'll meet you back at the tent.

originalText: I'll talk to you later. I have a lot to do right now.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I came to collect my paycheck.
No. Just came to say goodbye.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I'm here to collect my paycheck.
I hope you haven't packed everything yet. ::Barter.::
There was something I wanted to ask you.
I'll leave you to your work. Goodbye, Marcus.

originalText:
What can I say... it was a pleasure, $(context.player.Name). Sad it had to end this way, after so many lives were lost.

::He sighs.:: So long.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Hey, $(context.player.Name). Here to turn in your gear? One

originalText:
Well, the tent feels somewhat quiet and without a doubt a lot less raunchy, but it is what it is. 

This sea... it sure took many victims.
Goodbye, $(context.player.Name). You were a great sec-trooper.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I'd like to exchange dollars for charons.
Anyone around here exchanging United Stations dollars for charons?
I found this floatie-talkie. This is not a standard issue comm device, as far as I'm aware.
Chief Briggs told me to see you about collecting my gear.
Anything I can do to help with the camp's defenses?
I found some old naval mines we could deploy around the island.
I've negotiated a deal with the pirates so we can get those mines. The conditions were that any passing boat has to pay a toll, and there can't carry any armed men.
The way to J1 is pirate-free. We can now get those mines.
Have you managed to discover anything useful in the Keep about the island's defenses?
I'll leave you to your work. Goodbye, Marcus.

originalText:
Yes. Here you go. ::He hands you $(context.loc_xpbl_le_currentPaycheck) stygian coins.::

That should be everything Aegis Incorporated owes you.
I don't have anything for you. You've been paid in full.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: body armor, one helmet and one navcom.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Yes. Here you go. ::He hands you $(context.loc_xpbl_le_currentPaycheck) stygian coins.::
No. I have nothing for you, I'm afraid.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I'll give you one and a half stygian coins per dollar.
I can do it for you, $(context.player.Name). In fact, you can also pay in dollars when purchasing items from me or Doctor Savage.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Let me see. ::He inspects the device.:: It looks like a Biocorp Electronics North three-hundred series, waterproof. But this one seems to be made by Coretech.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: There is something you can do. The NFT had plenty of automated defenses deployed on this island. Most of it is destroyed, but perhaps there is something we can still use if we knew how, and that is something you can potentially discover during the course of your assignments.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Yeeeeeah! About time someone gets us some boomy floaty zone-outers, bwahahaha.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: We don't have any sec-troopers left to spare.
In that case I'll dispatch an armed transport to the location you specified.
Yes, we did. The Keep gave us great insight into how the defenders organized and managed their defenses, as well as how the automated defense system functioned.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Good work, $(context.player.Name). Anything we can do to boost our defenses will help save the lives of our sec-troopers and our staff.

originalText: $(context.player.Name): The camp's running low on electronic supplies. We're in no position to make supply trips back for more, so make the most use of what's available.

originalText: I've yet to get used to these stygian coins. I still think in terms of blues; United Stations dollars, I mean.

originalText: I used to have one of those when I was workin' as a buoy deployer. You could drop that ol' thing in the water and it'll stay afloat forever. Thing's hardcore. Unlike these Redingers... Assingers, more like it.
Where did you say you got this?

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Hey, Tone, would you mind handing me one of the suits?

originalText: We're taking him back with us. We're probably going to turn him over to Core City authorities.

前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: You can go and zone out the savages. That'd solve our problems.
Also, contact me if you find any functional military equipment and I'll dispatch a boat to transport it to the camp if possible.

前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
Boomy floaty...?

Where did you find them, $(context.player.Name)?
At J1. They appear to be in good condition. I just need you to send someone to pick them up.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Especially considering they'd have to go through pirate territory.
Having sec-troopers out of the camp at a moment like this is far too risky.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: They allowed me passage through their territory.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: You already know about the turrets
You already know about the Protectors,

There's no point discussing the island's fortifications, so I'll go straight to automated defenses: the smaller statuesque plasma turrets and the larger, more powerful plasma cannons. Apparently their primary tactic was to use the smaller turrets, with their higher rate of fire, to deplete the energy shields of enemy ships so the more powerful projectiles could pass through once the shields collapsed. 

At this stage, the turrets would target weak points or, based on their priorities, select other targets or to a limited degree complement the active protection system.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: However, I think we've done all we can regarding this island's security systems. Focus on your other assignments for now, $(context.player.Name), and let me know if anything new comes up.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I got some bad news first,

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Tone, Chief... Hard to believe they're gone.
Hard to believe the chief is gone.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: All I can say now is goodbye, Marcus.
First I'll need some supplies before I leave the camp. ::Barter.::
It's all here. ::Give him the armor, helmet and navcom.::
I left everything in my locker. I'll be right back.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Oh. I see. ::He nods.:: $(#His/her) coins are shinier than the ones I get. And here I thought we had... ah... something special. ::He sniffs.::
Wait... You should've gotten more coins. Marcus, you swipin' zoner.
Do waste it on brew and hookers, bwahaha.
I'll keep your coins safe... for coins. One-to-one deal. Who can say no to that?
Clean those coins well. I saw where he kept them.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: But not from me. No, siree. I still haven't gotten used to handlin' them Northern blue bills; it messes up my, uh, calculation. Besides, dollars look like Monorail money - real steel is where it's at, baby, real super *hardcore* steel.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: That overweight technician, um, dropped it.
It belonged to one of the technicians. The chubby one.
I stole it from the ample technician.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Where do you keep him exactly?
Tone, you can't expect $(#him/her) to attack the natives all on $(#his/her) own.
It's not much to go on, I know, but hopefully something'll come up.
I don't know... It's too dangerous to go through the pirate territory.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: If you say so. In that case I'll dispatch some laborers to the location you specified.
The area has been secured, but still be on the lookout for any creepers. The whole region is infested with them.
The whole region is infested with creepers, and so is the area where the mines are. Tell them to be on the lookout.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: but there are plenty of other systems which are no longer operational.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: There is a bonus waiting for you as well.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
::He inspects the items before placing them aside.::

It's all here.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: You wouldn't be here if it wasn't.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: You need to turn in your gear first.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Well, go get it for me, please. I need to have everything accounted for.
::He hands you your charons.:: Here you go, $(context.player.Name).
I'll take it from here. There is no reason anyone should be using a different comm. We don't issue these, so that technician either brought it himself, found it, or was given the comm by someone.

Hey, one of my crab sandwiches went missin'. Was that you as well, $(context.npc_xpbl_ladelman_playerName)?

Oh, wait - it went missin' in my belly, bwahaha. Khm, carry on.

Meanwhile, take this. ::He hands you a device.:: Here's a navcom - a navigation and communication device. Its communication range is substantial and should cover the entire Black Sea; still, I can't tell you how it is going to behave once you move beyond that or go into other cave systems or NFT facilities.
We've got an empty shipping container. It's the best place to keep him in right now. It's secure, and he's out of the way.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I've negotiated a deal with the pirates. You'll have to pay a toll, and there can't be any armed men on the boats.
The way to J1 is free. Don't you worry about the pirates.
What do you propose I do then?
What do you propose I do then?
::He nods.:: I'll brief the team as soon as possible.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
You should know as a Protectorate corporal. I mean, these kinds of systems are commonly used in Protectorate base defenses...

But I suppose Fort Apogee doesn't have or need one. Forget I said anything.

There are two components to the APS system, the *hard-kill* and *soft-kill* countermeasures: Hard-kill are the ones in which missiles and other projectiles are prevented from hitting their targets - targets belonging to the defenders - by physically intercepting and destroying them, like shooting them down with the turrets, although there were various other APS units installed. And soft-kill are measures that rely on some kind of interference, like electromagnetic or acoustic, that target sensors inside the projectiles.

And whatever got past the APS still had powerful energy shields to contend with.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: This is what we signed up for. I know I'm in this even if I end up at the bottom of the sea.
Keep your head up, sec-trooper. We'll pull through.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: And here's your pay. ::He hands you $(context.loc_xpbl_le_currentPaycheck) stygian coins.:: That should be everything we owe you.
You've already been paid for your work, so were clean.
I'll get to the bottom of this. Thanks. If you ever notice anything suspicious, let me know.

As for navigation, it's fairly simple: The screen will display the grid square of the currently loaded coordinate system you're in. Now, pay attention here: The coordinate system currently displayed is the one recovered from an NFT device. This means that the coordinates you read on NFT devices are the ones your navcom can point you to. We'll all be using those coordinates during the expedition, so we'll all understand each other. Hopefully. ::He smiles.::

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Uh, perhaps there is some other way...

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: All in all, the NFT truly had a highly advanced system, with some unique solutions. Like contemporary systems, everything could both be centrally controlled or could function autonomously. Combat statues were also a part of the system, sending and receiveing their targeting information.
::He makes a brief pause, nodding to himself.::

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: And... that's everything. What can I say... it was a pleasure, $(context.player.Name).

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: ::He points to the navcom's display.:: Right now we're in D6, as you can see. Just to make it clear: Letters represent your position along the east-west axis, numbers along your north-south axis.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Can he even breathe in there?
Can't he still make a lot of noise in there?
What if he starts hitting his head against the wall?
So, what's going to happen to him after all of this?
Good. There was something else I wanted to ask...

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: We haven't seen him in a while, but maybe that old ferryman would be willing to help you.
Maybe that old ferryman would be willing to help you.
Damn, Marky, I couldn't understand half of what you were sayin'! The only active protection system I use is not takin' a bath, bwahahaha!
That's all we've managed to learn

Here. ::Tony approaches you with a complete suit of Aegis Incorporated combat armor in his hands. As he returns to his spot behind the desk, you notice him putting away a couple of nylon bags which were most likely used to store the items he just gave you.::

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Maybe they drilled 'im a few holes. In the container, not in 'im, bwahaha!

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Yeeeeeah. Then he got some hardcore beatin' and stopped, the rodworker.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I saw the sec-troops pad the walls with some mattreses and stuff, and he's shackled in there, I think.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
Damn it, $(context.npc_xpbl_ladelman_playerName), now I'm imaginin' a fat guy squatin' over a bucket 'cause of you!

I don't know! He's got somethin'.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: He's either going to get shot or get turned in to Core City authorities when we return.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: He's been uncooperative so far, but who knows. That's all I could think of.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I can tell, Tone. I've been stuck in this tent with you for far too long...

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I can't believe that uncultured pipeworker fired the Invictus $(#himself/herself)! Come on, man!
I can't believe he fired you, $(context.npc_xpbl_ladelman_playerName) $(#himself/herself). You don't get gladiators workin' for you every day, for pipe's sake.
I deserved it. I should be getting sacked.
I'm not done here, you know.
Yeah, well... ::Shrug your shoulders.:: whatcha gonna do.
Where would I be if the chief wasn't such a piece of rat crap...
And I did so much for this stinking expedition.

There's your armor. I don't think I should explain how to put it on. You have your own weapons - or that's what I've been told - but if you need anything from our armory, talk to that guy over there. ::He points to Ladelman.::
The Chief has yet to decide.
The Chief hadn't made the decision, and we've haven't yet either.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: . If you haven't already, go speak to Seeger. He's recovered a log from one... I think a security marine.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Sucks to see you go, $(context.npc_xpbl_ladelman_playerName). I liked your style. ::He fist bumps you.::

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: I must advise you not to interfere with our work here. However you may feel now, doing something like that will only end badly for you.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: Haven't read it yet, but I've been told it
::He hesitates, then fists bumps you too but does it somewhat awkwardly.::

That's him. He's also got weapon attachments, spare parts and a plethora of other, related items. If you need energy weapons or anything hi-tech, on the other hand, see me. 

And that should be... Oh, yes, wait, let's just check if the comm is working properly. Push that button, that one there, and say something.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: contains some information regarding the final moments from the battle.
I am Corporal $(context.player.Name) of the Underrail Protectorate.
Tchort is evolution. Evolution is Tchort.
One, two, three - I really have to pee.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも
前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText: You shouldn't be joking with that, $(context.player.Name). Especially not around Chief Briggs.

description: 前後のテキストの状況を示すヒントになるかも

originalText:
::He speaks into his own communicator.:: Testing, testing... Can you hear me? Can. you. hear. me?

Alright, everything appears to be in order. The device will display a name next to each of the channels so you can know who you're talking to. I'm on channel one. Contact me if you need some help, info, or if you need to speak to someone from the staff who doesn't have a comm of his own.
Yeah, checking the pipes doesn't rhyme as good with that. Oh, well.
Where'd you hear that? It's either over or out. Over is "over to you," and it means I'm done, you go ahead. Out is I'm done and don't expect a reply. Over and out... makes no sense. Anyway...
That's it. You got your gear and I hope everything was clear.
